title: How to Make Lilac Liqueur

steps.headline: Place two bunches of lilac flowers into the brandy.
Strain the lilac flowers out.
steps.description: Add the next two bunches of flowers. Allow to infuse for another 12 hours.

steps.headline: Strain this round.
steps.description: Next, add the remaining two bunches of flowers. Allow to infuse for another 12 hours.

steps.headline: Finally, strain out the last two bunches of lilac flowers.
Make a simple syrup from the sugar and water.
steps.description: Once made, let it cool down again.

steps.headline: Pour the cold syrup into the lilac infused brandy.
Seal tight.
steps.description: Leave to infuse for four to six weeks in a cool, dry and dark place. After the infusion time is up, taste test to see if it is ready.

text: Place two bunches of lilac flowers into the brandy. Leave to infuse for 12 hours. Strain the lilac flowers out. Add the next two bunches of flowers. Allow to infuse for another 12 hours. Strain this round. Next, add the remaining two bunches of flowers. Allow to infuse for another 12 hours. Finally, strain out the last two bunches of lilac flowers.  Make a simple syrup from the sugar and water. Once made, let it cool down again. Pour the cold syrup into the lilac infused brandy.  Seal tight. Leave to infuse for four to six weeks in a cool, dry and dark place. After the infusion time is up, taste test to see if it is ready.
